revised_title: Anatomy of Symmetrical Double Monstrosities in the Trout
tldr: This paper investigates the anatomy of symmetrical double monstrosities in trout embryos, examining the fusion, disappearance, and adaptation of parts in the region of transition from the double to the single condition. The study covers various types of monstrosities, including union in the head region, pectoral region, and by the yolk-sac only, providing detailed descriptions of the cranial, visceral, and vertebral skeletons, as well as other anatomical structures.
